questions.question_text: Which of the following areas MUST all other OSPF areas connect to in a properly configured network?

discussion.content: Ok, best of luck with this one.

questions.question_text: Which of the following should a first responder perform when arriving at a site to perform a basic forensic investigation?

discussion.content: I'm leaning towards A in the exam.

choices.B: Search for hidden storage devices and duplicate them on site.
choices.C: Power off all computers and devices to stop them from erasing data.
choices.A: Isolate the area and block radio transmissions to the device.
choices.D: Utilize a strong magnet to secure all data on drives from being erased.

discussion.content:
C maybe a viable answer but in a real-world environment, any network engineer worth their salt always keeps tabs on budget constraints, as in opt for the least effort, less-costly option available first. 

Ergo: CSMA-CD has gone the way of the dodo since most modern networks implement Full-duplex traffic (with each each port is a separate collision domain), so, if CSMA-CD has been enabled, verify as to why this is the case first and if found out that certain nodes are still hardwired to use half duplex (i.e. ancient by networking standards) then the budget may be better spent at upgrading | replacing those nodes (any device connected to the network) than boosting the server with additional NICs (which after all may be required after all in order to adjust to the more efficient newer nodes - its a never-ending circle in this business :P)

It could be that with full duplex enabled can solve the problem in time, money and convenience all around...

...and document all findings | actions taken always; you never know...:)

choices.A: Add a honeypot to reduce traffic to the server
choices.C: Add additional network cards to the server
choices.B: Update the Ethernet drivers to use 802.3

questions.question_text:
A network administrator is noticing slow responds times from the server to hosts on the network. After adding several new hosts, the administrator realizes that
CSMA/CD results in network slowness due to congestion at the server NIC.
Which of the following should the network administrator do to correct the issue?

discussion.content: Edit: ICMP has no concept of ports, as TCP and UDP do, but instead uses types and codes. Commonly used ICMP types are echo request and echo reply (used for ping) and time to live exceeded in transit (used for traceroute).
"EIGRP does not operate using the Transmission Control Protocol (TCP) or the User Datagram Protocol (UDP). This means that EIGRP does not use a port number to identify traffic"

questions.question_text: Which of the following uses types and codes rather than ports?
Which of the following is characterized by an attacker attempting to map out an organization's staff hierarchy in order to send targeted emails?

discussion.content:
Spear phishing is the act of sending and emails to specific and well-researched targets while purporting to be a trusted sender

Whaling is a highly targeted phishing attack - aimed at senior executives - masquerading as a legitimate email. Whaling is digitally enabled fraud through social engineering, designed to encourage victims to perform a secondary action, such as initiating a wire transfer of funds.
